skill.name: wp-test-analyzer
skill.description: Analyze WordPress theme PHP files to extract testable elements for E2E test generation with Playwright.
skill.summary: Extract forms, navigation, dynamic content, and JavaScript interactions from WordPress themes for automated testing.
skill.author: CrazySwami

security_audit.summary: All 29 static findings are false positives. The skill is a legitimate WordPress theme analyzer that uses safe file reading and regex pattern matching. No cryptography, command execution, or network access present. The flagged items are documentation examples, JSON metadata, and standard file validation.

content.user_title: Analyze WordPress Themes for E2E Test Generation
content.value_statement: WordPress developers struggle to identify all testable elements in their themes for comprehensive E2E testing. This skill automatically scans PHP and JavaScript files to extract forms, navigation menus, dynamic content, and interactions, generating structured test data for Playwright.
actual_capabilities: Extract form structures with fields, nonces, and validation patterns from WordPress theme PHP files
Identify navigation menus, internal links, and external links with classes and attributes
Detect dynamic content patterns including WP_Query loops, conditionals, and post meta fields
Find JavaScript interactions such as onclick handlers, class toggles, and ID-based targets
Discover custom post types, theme options, and AJAX hooks for comprehensive test coverage
Generate JSON or markdown reports of all testable elements with file locations and line numbers
limitations: Only analyzes static PHP and JavaScript files, cannot detect runtime-generated content or database-driven elements
Regex-based parsing may miss complex or obfuscated code patterns that use dynamic variable names
Does not execute WordPress code or connect to databases, so cannot validate actual behavior
Limited to theme files only, does not analyze plugins or WordPress core functionality

use_cases.title: QA Engineers Building Test Suites
use_cases.description: Quality assurance engineers can analyze WordPress themes to automatically generate comprehensive test case lists for Playwright, ensuring complete coverage of forms, navigation, and interactive elements without manual inspection.

use_cases.title: WordPress Developers Planning Tests
use_cases.description: Theme developers can scan their work-in-progress themes to identify all testable components, helping plan testing strategies and ensure no critical user flows are missed during development cycles.

use_cases.title: DevOps Teams Documenting Themes
use_cases.description: DevOps teams can use the generated reports to document theme functionality, understand form submission flows, and identify dependencies before deployment or migration projects.

best_practices: Run the analyzer on clean, committed code to ensure consistent results and enable comparison across versions
Use JSON output format for automated test generation pipelines and markdown format for human review and documentation
Analyze theme subdirectories separately if dealing with large parent-child theme structures to isolate testable elements by context
anti_patterns: Do not run the analyzer on themes with syntax errors or incomplete PHP files, as regex parsing may produce incomplete results
Avoid analyzing themes from untrusted sources without reviewing the code first, as the analyzer will report all elements without security validation
Do not rely solely on automated extraction for critical business logic testing, as complex conditional flows may require manual test case design

faq.question: What types of WordPress elements can this skill detect?
faq.answer: The analyzer extracts forms with fields and nonces, navigation menus, links with classes, WP_Query loops, conditionals, post meta fields, onclick handlers, class toggles, custom post types, theme options, and JavaScript animation functions from PHP and JS files.

faq.question: Does this skill work with WordPress plugins or only themes?
faq.answer: This skill is designed specifically for WordPress theme analysis. It scans PHP and JavaScript files in a theme directory structure. Plugin analysis would require similar techniques but is not currently supported.

faq.question: Can the analyzer detect security vulnerabilities in WordPress themes?
faq.answer: No, this is a testability analyzer, not a security scanner. It identifies elements for functional testing purposes. For security analysis, use dedicated WordPress security scanning tools.

faq.question: What output formats are supported by the analyzer?
faq.answer: The skill generates either JSON output for automated test generation and programmatic consumption, or markdown format for human-readable documentation and review. Specify format using the --output flag.

faq.question: How does the analyzer handle dynamic content generated by WordPress at runtime?
faq.answer: The analyzer performs static code analysis only. It identifies patterns like WP_Query and get_post_meta calls in the source code, but cannot detect content that is generated dynamically at runtime or retrieved from the database.

faq.question: Does the skill require a running WordPress installation to analyze themes?
faq.answer: No, the analyzer works entirely on static files. It reads PHP and JavaScript files from the filesystem using regex pattern matching. No WordPress installation, database connection, or web server is required.
